org.foxlabs.validation.converter

Class AbstractConverter<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.foxlabs.validation.AbstractValidation<V>
      • org.foxlabs.validation.converter.AbstractConverter<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of value to be converted
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converter<V>, Validation<V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanConverter, CharacterConverter, ClassConverter, DateConverter, EnumConverter, FileConverter, LocaleConverter, LogLevelConverter, NumberConverter, StringConverter, TimeZoneConverter, Tokenizer, URIConverter, URLConverter

    public abstract class AbstractConverter<V>
extends AbstractValidation<V>
implements Converter<V>
    This class provides base implementation of the Converter interface.
    Author:
    Fox Mulder

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public <T> V decode(String value,
                    ValidationContext<T> context)
        Converts string representation of value into object.

        Invokes doDecode(String, ValidationContext) if value is not null or empty; returns null otherwise.

        Specified by:
        decode in interface Converter<V>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of validated entity.
        Parameters:
        value - String representation of value.
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        Decoded value.
        Throws:
        MalformedValueException - if conversion fails.
        See Also:
        doDecode(String, ValidationContext)

      • doDecode

        protected <T> V doDecode(String value,
                         ValidationContext<T> context)
        Converts non-empty string representation of value into object.

        This method always throws MalformedValueException and should be overriden in subclasses.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of validated entity.
        Parameters:
        value - Non-empty string representation of value.
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        Decoded value.
        Throws:
        MalformedValueException - always.

      • encode

        public <T> String encode(V value,
                         ValidationContext<T> context)
        Converts value into string representation.

        Invokes doEncode(Object, ValidationContext) if value is not null; returns empty string otherwise.

        Specified by:
        encode in interface Converter<V>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of validated entity.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to be encoded.
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        String representation of value.
        See Also:
        doEncode(Object, ValidationContext)

      • doEncode

        protected <T> String doEncode(V value,
                              ValidationContext<T> context)
        Converts null-safe value into string representation.

        This method simply returns value.toString() and could be overriden in subclasses.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of validated entity.
        Parameters:
        value - Null-safe value to be encoded.
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        String representation of value.
